taxon_name.authority: A. St.-Hilaire in A. St.-Hilaire et al.

bio:treatment.description: bractlets green to tan. Flowers: sepals 4–7 mm; petals red-orange, 10–12 mm; anthers yellow. Schizocarps ± hemispheric; mericarps 12–17, 2.5–3 × 2–3 mm, chartaceous, nonreticulate dehiscent part 30–40% of height, tip rounded, indehiscent part wider than dehiscent part. Seeds 1 per mericarp, brown, glabrous or pubescent. 2n = 10.
Ariz., Calif.; Mexico (Baja California, Baja California Sur, Sonora).
bio:treatment.discussion: Sphaeralcea orcuttii has distinctive trullate leaf blades and an erect habit.
